member.summary: The level of revelance. 0 mean probably not a bounce. 1 mean this email is suspicious. 2 mean this is a potential bounce email. 3 mean we are quite sure that is a bounce email.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.Net.Mail.Codec
member.summary: Contains several static methods providing encoding/decoding in various formats.

member.name: F:ActiveUp.Net.Mail.Codec.whiteSpace
member.summary: Detect whitespace between encoded words as stated by RFC2047

member.name: F:ActiveUp.Net.Mail.Codec.encodedWord
member.summary: Detect encoded words as stated by RFC2047

member.name: M:ActiveUp.Net.Mail.Codec.ToQuotedPrintable(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Encodes the text in quoted-printable format conforming to the RFC 2045 and RFC 2046.
member.remarks: The lines are wrapped to a length of max 78 characters to ensure data integrity across some gateways.
member.returns: The input encoded as 7bit quoted-printable data, in the form of max 78 characters lines.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.Net.Mail.Codec.RFC2047Encode(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Encodes the given string in a format (specified in RFC 2047) that can be used in RFC 2822 headers to represent non-ASCII textual data.
member.param: The string to be encoded (the Header field's value).
The charset of the Header field's value.
member.returns: The encoded string with only 7bit characters.
member.remarks: ActiveMail only encodes in this format using Base64, but the RFC2047Decode method also decodes string encoded in this format with quoted-printable.
member.example:
The example below illustrates the encoding of a string.
C#
string input = "ActiveMail rocks ! Here are some non-ASCII characters =ç."; string output = Codec.RFC2047Encode(input,"iso-8859-1");
output returns =?iso-8859-1?B?QWN0aXZlTWFpbCByb2NrcyAhIEhlcmUgYXJlIHNvbWUgd2VpcmQgY2hhcmFjdGVycyA95y4=?=
This value can be used as for example the subject of a message. If you suspect the text to contain non ASCII characters, do message.Subject = Codec.RFC2047Encode(yourRawValue);.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.Net.Mail.Codec.GetEncoding(System.String)
member.summary: Return encoding based on encoding name Tries to resolve some wrong-formatted encoding names

member.name: M:ActiveUp.Net.Mail.Codec.RFC2047Decode(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes the given string from the format specified in RFC 2047 (=?charset?value?=).
member.returns: The decoded string.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.Net.Mail.Codec.FromQuotedPrintable(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Decodes text from quoted-printable format defined in RFC 2045 and RFC 2046.
member.returns: The decoded data.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.Net.Mail.Codec.Wrap(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Wraps the given string to a set of lines of a maximum given length.
member.param: The maximum length for each line.
member.returns: The data as a set of lines of a maximum length.
member.remarks: This can be used to wrap lines to a maximum length of 78 characters to ensure data integrity across some gateways.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.Net.Mail.Crypto
member.summary: Contains several static methods providing cryptographic digesting and transformations.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.Net.Mail.Crypto.MD5Digest(System.String)
member.summary: Digests the given string using the MD5 algorithm.
member.remarks: This method is used for APOP authentication.
member.returns: A 16 bytes digest representing the data.
member.example:
The example below illustrates the use of this method.
C#
string data = "ActiveMail rocks ! Let's see how this string is digested..."; string digest = Crypto.MD5Digest(data);
digest returns 3ff3501885f8602c4d8bf7edcd2ceca1
Digesting is used to check data equivalence. Different data result in different digests.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.Net.Mail.Crypto.HMACMD5Digest(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Applies the HMAC-MD5 keyed algorithm to the given string using the given key.
member.remarks: This method is used for CRAM-MD5 authentication.
member.returns: The transformed data as a 16 bytes digest.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.Net.Security.Signature.GetContentLength(System.Byte[],System.Int32@)
member.summary: This method extracts the DER encoded length of a content tag in the byte array. This method assumes that the specified lengthStartIndex is located at the first length byte. When this method returns, the lengthStartIndex will have been modified to point to the first byte of the actual content that follows the length byte(s).

member.name: M:ActiveUp.Net.Security.Signature.CopyContent(System.Byte[],System.Int32@,System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: This method copies the content bytes of the current content node specified by the startIndex value. This method assumes that startIndex is located at the first byte of the length byte(s). This method assumes that the content is an DER encoded Integer value.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.Net.Mail.Header.GetBounceStatus(System.String)
member.summary: Detects if a message is a delivery failure notification. This method uses the default signatures containing in an internal ressource file.
member.remarks:
Signature files are XML files formatted as follows :
<?xml version='1.0'?> <signatures> <signature from="postmaster" subject="Undeliverable Mail" body="Unknown user" search="" /> ... </signatures>
member.returns: A BounceStatus object containing the level of revelance and if 100% identified, the erroneous email address.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.Net.Mail.Header.Sender
member.summary: Sender of the message.
member.remark: The sender's address can be specified if the person that actually post the message is different from the message originator. For exemple a secretary should send a message on the behalf of the CEO. In that particular car, the CEO's email address is set on the From property, and the secretary on the Sender property.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.Net.Mail.Header.ReturnReceipt
member.summary: Gets or sets the return receipt email. This will enable the delivery notification.

summary.para: Gets or sets the email address where a read confirmation should be sent. Please note that use recipient may ignore this receipt. In that case, you won't receive anything.
Please note that if you are receiving the message, the property will return null if the sender doesn't request a read receipt, otherwise, an Address object will be available.

example.code:
Dim msg As ActiveUp.Net.Mail.Message = New ActiveUp.Net.Mail.Message() msg.From.Name = "User1" msg.From.Email = "user1@example.com" msg.To.Add("user2@example.com") msg.Subject = "Confirm Read" msg.BodyHtml.Text = "The HTML body"
' This Is the pragmatic solution msg.ConfirmRead = msg.From
' But you can specify it yourself msg.ConfirmRead = New Address("user4", "user4@example.com")

<?xml version='1.0'?> <signatures> <signature from="postmaster" subject="Undeliverable Mail" body="Unknown user" search="" /> ... </signatures>
